--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, "peter.goras"
<peter.goras@...> wro=
te:
> is it possible to connect two decide rules with a logical AND?
> 
> L=
ets say I want on the one hand the URI to match a RegExp and on the
> other=
 hand the URI content type to match another RegExp. The URI
> should only b=
e accepted if both decide rules are accepted.

Here are some thoughts about=
 heritrix 1.x (may or may not apply to 2.x):

My understanding is that any =
particular decide rule sequence can be
either additive or subtractive (or d=
o nothing):

Styles of decide rule sequences:
A. PASS (meaning "pass over a=
nd do nothing" or Not Applicable) 
B. REJECT by default "unless..." (additi=
ve)
C. ACCEPT by default "unless..." (subtractive)

(I wish NA for Not Appl=
icable were used instead of PASS... it is very
easy to mix up PASS and ACCE=
PT; it's like a built-in Stroop Test.)

Rule sequences start out in style A=
.  Style C might approach the
logical (x AND y) you want like this:

1. ACC=
EPT 
2. REJECT not in x
3. REJECT not in y

or 

1. ACCEPT 
2. REJECT NotMa=
tchesFilePattern
3. REJECT ContentTypeNotMatches
